intro: Heteropterys hassleriana f. amblyobasis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed heteropterys, is a variant of the species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale green, followed by elliptical, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. The foliage is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
